author: bridge-bot
content:
<gr3999> re: **@barnabasbusa**
> lifetime generally means in seconds or in slots ?
lifetime = how many times can you sign (since these scheme are extended form of one time signature schemes).

if in current beacon scenario, it would be epochs (thats why you will see some epoch terminology here and there)
but for our current case of pqdevnet we are using 3SF mini where validators vote in all slots, so lifetime here is slots.

but may be we have some different finality mechanism where all validators have some other frequency of voting, so lifetime there would mean that instances there.

also note that extra signature is consumed each time validator proposes, but in terms of the lifetime numbers but all those will be inconsequential to the lifetime number we will choose.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<gr3999> by the way Justin/Benedikt/Thomas:

will we be keeping track of last signed leaf index of a validator in the state or leave the security of the signature totally up to the validator? This will be relvant for e.g. there isa fresh instance of validator being spinned up on a new machine or system crash?

also what if the signature was on wire and not included, but has been revealed to the world, so validator can't actually use that index again. There is another edge case in that scenario that validator signed, signature onwire and disk crash so validator doesn't know that it actually consumed some particular lead index
